Eli Raphael Roth (born April 18, 1972) is an American director, producer, writer, and actor. He is known for directing horror movies, such as "Cabin Fever" (2003) and "Hostel" (2005). He also directed the action movie "Death Wish" (2018), a remake of the 1974 original.
As an actor, Roth starred as Donny "The Bear Jew" Donowitz in Quentin Tarantino's war movie "Inglourious Basterds" (2009), for which he received a Critic's Choice Movie Award and a SAG Award.
